gurmukhi: nIr FrY Btvwn kI AwNKn lotq hY icq mY duK pwey ]sIs DunY iek AYsy khY hmhUM jdubIr ky kwm n Awey ]2053]
transliteration: Neer Ddarai Bhatvaan Kiaankhan Lotat Hai Chit Mai Doukh Paae|| Sees Dhounai Ik Aise Kahai Ham-hoon Jadoubeer Ke Kaam Na Aae||2053||
translation: The water flowed from the eyes of the warriors and they began to roll on the earth in affliction; several of them repented that they had not been of any use to Krishna.2053.

gurmukhi: sYn ijqo jdubIr ky sMg gXo soaU BUp pY rovq AwXo ]BUpiq dyK dSw iqn kI Aiq hI Apny mn mY duKu pwXo ]
transliteration: Sain Jito Jadoubeer Ke San Gado Sooo Bhoop Pai Rovat Aayo|| Bhoopat(i) Dekh Dashaa Tin Kiat(i) Hiapne Man Mai Doukh(u) Paayo||
translation: The army accompanying Krishna came back to the king and wept, seeing which the king became extremely sorrowful;

gurmukhi: Dwie gXo blBdR pY pUCn roie iehI iqn bYn sunwXo ]kwnH guPw ky ibKY Dis kY iqh qy bhuro nhI bwhir AwXo ]2054]
transliteration: Dhaae Gado Balbhadra Pai Poochhan Roe Ehitin Bain Sounaayo|| Kaahn Gouphaa Ke Bikhai Dhas(i) Kai Tih Te Bahuro Nahibaahar(i) Aayo||2054||
translation: He ran towards Balram to consult him, but he also told the same thing that Krishna went into the cave, bud did not turn back.2054.

gurmukhi: kY lir kY Air kwhU ky sMg qn Awpn ko jmlok pTwXo ]Kojq kY min Xw jV kI bil lok gXo koaU mwrg pwXo ]
transliteration: Kai Lar(i) Kai Ar(i) Kaahoo Ke Santan Aapan Ko Jamlok Pathaayo|| Khojat Kai Man(i) Yaa Jad Kibal(i) Lok Gado Ko( i)  Maarag Paayo||
translation: “Either Krishna has been killed at the hands of the enemy or has gone to the nether-world in search of the jewel of this foolish Satrajit,

gurmukhi: kY min lY ieh BRwq ky pRwn gXo jm lY iqn lYn kau DwXo ]kY ieh mUrK ko su kubol lgXo huie ljwqur Dwm n AwXo ]2055]
transliteration: Kai Man(i) Lai Eh Bhraat Ke Praan Gado Jam Lai Tin Lain Kau Dhaayo|| Kai Eh Moondakh Ko Su Koubol Lagyo Hue Lajaatur Dhaam Na Aayo||2055||
translation: “Or he has gone to bring back the life-force (soul) of his brother from Yama or he has not returned after feeling shy of the words of this foolish man.”2055.

gurmukhi: roie jbY sMg BUpiq ky muK qy muslI ieh BwNiq aucwrXo ]qau S`qRwijq kau imil kY sB jwdv lwqn mUkn mwrXo ]
transliteration: Roe Jabai San Bhoopat(i) Ke Moukh Te Mouslieh Bhaant(i) Ouchdaryo|| Tau Shattraajit Kau Mil(i) Kai Sabh Jaadav Laatan Moondan Moondan Mdaryo||
translation: When Balram said all this to the king while weeping, then all the Yadavas together beat Satrajit with legs and fists;

gurmukhi: pwg auqwr deI muSkY gih gofn qy miD kUp qy fwrXo ]Cofb qw ko khXo n ikhU sBhU iqh ko bDbo icq DwrXo ]2056]
transliteration: Paag Outaar Daimoush Kai Gadh Godan Te Madh(i) Koop Te Ddaryo|| Chhodhbe Taa Ko Kahyo Na Kihoo Sabh-hoo Tih Ko Badh-bo Chit Dhdaryo||2056||
translation: His turban was removed and tying his hands and feet, he was thrown in a well; no one advised for his release and contemplated to kill him.2056.

gurmukhi: kwnHr kI jb ey bqIXw pRB kI sB nwrn jau sun pweI ]rovq BI koaU BUim prI igr pItq BI kir kY duicqweI ]
transliteration: Kaahnar Kijab E Bateeyaa Prabh Kisabh Naaran Jau Soun Paaee|| Rovat Bhikooo Bhoom(i) Pariir Peetat Bhikar(i) Kai Douchitaaee||
translation: When the women heard these things regarding Krihsna, they fell down weeping on the earth and some of them lamented;

gurmukhi: eyk khY piq pRwn qjY Ab huie hY khw hmrI gq mweI ]Aaur ruk`min dyq idjoqm dwn sqI Pun hoby kau AweI ]2057]
transliteration: Ek Kahai Pat(i) Praan Tajai Ab Hue Hai Kahaa Hamrigad Maaee|| Aur Roukamman(i) Det Dijotam Daan Satiphoun Hobe Kau Aaee||2057||
translation: Someone said that her husband had breathed his last, what would be her condition then, Rukmani gave gifts to the Brahmins and thought of becoming a Sati (dying on the funeral pyre of the husband).2057.
